definitions.definition: To fill (something) so that it is not possible to pass.
To prevent (something or someone) from passing.
definitions.example: You're blocking the road â€“ I can't get through!

definitions.definition: To prevent (something from happening or someone from doing something).
definitions.example: His plan to take over the business was blocked by the boss.
He blocked the basketball player's shot.

definitions.definition: To specify the positions and movements of the actors.
definitions.example: It was very difficult to block this scene convincingly.

definitions.definition: To disable communication via telephone, instant messaging, etc., with an undesirable someone.
definitions.example: I tried to send you a message, but you've blocked me!
When the condition expression is false, the thread blocks on the condition variable.

definitions.definition: To stretch or mould (a knitted item, a hat, etc.) into the desired shape.
definitions.example: I blocked the mittens by wetting them and pinning them to a shaped piece of cardboard.

definitions.definition: To shape or sketch out roughly.

definitions.example: This road is blocked, so we must find another route.

definitions.definition: Obstructed impeding total flow in a pipe, etc.
definitions.example: Call a plumber to unclog the blocked drain.
